metadata.title: CVE-2019-11085 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient input validation in Kernel Mode Driver in Intel(R) i915Graphics for Linux before version 5.0 may allow an authenticated user topotentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11085` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.2.0-1013-raspi2 - 4.2.0-1013.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1012-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-55-generic - 4.15.0-55.60~16.04.2
linux-image-4.15.0-55-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-55.60~16.04.2
linux-image-4.15.0-55-lowlatency - 4.15.0-55.60~16.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-55-generic - 4.15.0-55.60~16.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-55-lowlatency - 4.15.0-55.60~16.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1051-azure - 4.15.0-1051.56
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1037-gcp - 4.15.0-1037.39~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1047-aws - 4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1018-oracle - 4.15.0-1018.20~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1051.56').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1037.39~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
